Expert Economic Services for Legal and Business Clients

Court-tested forensic economics and business valuation expertise serving attorneys and business professionals throughout Rhode Island, Massachusetts, and New England.

Comprehensive Economic Analysis & Valuation Services

Skerritt Economics & Consulting provides reliable economic analysis and business valuation services to the legal community. Our expertise spans forensic economics for personal injury and employment cases, business valuations for litigation and planning, and specialized consulting for complex economic issues.

We understand that each case presents unique challenges requiring tailored economic solutions. Whether you need damage calculations for a catastrophic injury case, business valuation for shareholder litigation, or economic analysis for employment disputes, we provide the rigorous methodology and clear communication your case demands.

Forensic Economics

Comprehensive economic damage analysis for personal injury, wrongful death, and employment litigation, providing economic foundations for case evaluation and trial testimony.

What We Calculate

  • Lost earnings and earning capacity
  • Medical and life care cost projections
  • Household services replacement value
  • Fringe benefits and employment perquisites
  • Economic support in wrongful death cases
  • Present value determinations

Personal Injury Medical Malpractice Employment Litigation

Business Valuation

Professional business appraisals using accepted valuation methodologies for litigation support, shareholder disputes, divorce proceedings, and estate planning.

Valuation Services

  • Fair market value determinations
  • Fair value for dissenting shareholders
  • Marital asset valuation for divorce
  • Estate and gift tax valuations
  • Lost profits and business damages
  • Purchase price allocations

Our Methodology & Standards

Court-Ready Analysis

All analyses follow accepted economic principles and methodologies that meet court standards for expert testimony admissibility.

Current Data Sources

We utilize the most current economic data from Bureau of Labor Statistics, Census Bureau, and Federal Reserve sources.

Peer Review Standards

Our methodologies are consistent with those published in peer-reviewed economics journals and professional practice standards.

Clear Communication

Complex economic concepts are explained clearly for judges and juries, with compelling visual presentations.

Our Process

1

Initial Consultation

Free case assessment to determine economic issues, required analyses, and preliminary damage estimates.

2

Data Collection

Gather relevant financial records, employment history, medical documentation, and other case materials.

3

Economic Analysis

Apply appropriate methodologies to calculate economic damages or business values using current data sources.

4

Report Delivery

Comprehensive written report with supporting documentation, charts, and visual presentations for settlement or trial.

5

Expert Testimony

Deposition and trial testimony explaining analyses and responding to questioning and opposing experts.

Our Approach

Examples of our economic analysis work across different practice areas and case types.

Construction Worker Injury Case

Practice Area: Personal Injury

Economic Issue: Lost earning capacity for injured union electrician

Approach: Comprehensive lost earning capacity analysis utilizing union wage progressions and benefit calculations

Medical Practice Valuation

Practice Area: Shareholder Dispute

Economic Issue: Fair value determination for departing physician partner

Approach: Multi-method valuation approach utilizing income, market, and asset-based methodologies

Wrongful Termination Case

Practice Area: Employment Litigation

Economic Issue: Back pay and front pay calculations for executive

Approach: Detailed economic analysis incorporating mitigation efforts and career progression factors
